channel.title: Law & Blockchain – The Bitcoin Podcast Network

image.title: Law & Blockchain – The Bitcoin Podcast Network

item.title: Law & Blockchain #12: Pamela Morgan
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Julian Kwan Pamela Morgan is an educator, entrepreneur, author, and attorney who has been working exclusively with bitcoin & open blockchains since early 2014. Morgan is a widely respected authority on multi-signature governance and legal innovation in digital currencies. Donate to the Bitcoin Podcast: https://the-bitcoin-podcast.github.io/

item.title: Law & Blockchain #11: Julian Kwan
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Julian Kwan Julian Kwan discusses the state of security tokens in Asia, with a particular focus on attitudes towards security tokens in Singapore. Donate to the Bitcoin Podcast: https://the-bitcoin-podcast.github.io/

item.title: Law & Blockchain #10: Andrea Tinianow
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Andrea Tinianow Founding Director of the Delaware Blockchain Initiative Andrea Tinianow discusses Delaware’s initiatives in changing and clarifying corporate laws around blockchain, how blockchain can help states generate revenue, and why the companies of tomorrow may be putting their corporate charters on blockchain. Donate to the Bitcoin Podcast: https://the-bitcoin-podcast.github.io/

item.title: Law & Blockchain #9: Juan Hernandez & Patrick Daugherty
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Juan Hernandez & Patrick Daugherty In December 2018, the first regulated security token trading platform in the U.S. began trading security tokens. In this show, I’m joined by Juan Hernandez of Open Finance Network and Patrick Daugherty of Foley & Lardner LLP, their counsel, to discuss the challenges and hurdles in achieving this milestone, […]

item.title: Law & Blockchain #8: Marc Borion & Jason Gottlieb
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Marc Borion & Jason Gottlieb We’re kicking off 2019 with a special episode that summarizes the state of U.S. regulatory statements and enforcement actions around ICOs and discuss what’s to come for the security token space in 2019. Guests include Marc Borion, Partner at Fisher Broyles and Jason Gottlieb, Partner at Morrison Cohen.

item.title: Law & Blockchain #7: David Silver
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: David Silver On this episode, Amy interviews David Silver, an investment fraud lawyer and founder of the Silver Miller law firm. He is suing cryptocurrency companies such as Coinbase, Kraken, Nano, and others in an attempt to protect investors from fraud. Recently he has opened suits against ATT, Sprint, and T-Mobile for their alleged […]

item.title: Law & Blockchain #6: Justin Newton
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Justin Newton Amy and Justin Newton discuss the state of anti-money launder (AML) and know-your-customer (KYC) laws as it pertains to blockchain technology and crypto. Justin Newton is an early internet pioneer and technology startup veteran. His last four companies (BlackLine, Demand Media, NetZero and Above Net) all exited with +$1 Billion IPOs. He […]

item.title: Law & Blockchain #5: Ken Moyle
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Ken Moyle Amy and Ken Moyle discuss the impact of blockchain on the e-signature industry and document authentication, generally. Ken Moyle was DocuSignâ€™s Chief Legal & Policy Officer and is Chair of the Public Policy Committee of the Electronic Signature and Records Association. Currently, Ken is President & Chief Legal Officer of K6 Partners, […]

item.title: Law & Blockchain #4: Georgia Quinn
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Georgia Quinn As Chair of the Advisory Board and Co-founder of iDisclose, Georgia Quinn assists entrepreneurs and small and startup businesses access capital and other resources they need in order to grow and prosper. She also is on the General Counsel at Coinlist, which is building the platform where the best digital asset companies […]

item.title: Law & Blockchain #3: Ragnar Lifthasir
item.dc:creator: Corey Petty
item.description: Guests: Ragnar Lifthasir On this episode Amy sits down with Ragnar Lifthrasir. Whose sole purpose is to reboot the real estate industry with Bitcoin / Blockchain. Amy and Ragnar define the process of tokenizing real estate. Taking paper deeds and turning them into digital deeds! Enjoy! https://www.linkedin.com/in/ragnarlifthrasir/ Donate: – BTC: 1DzakJiMj9cTkQiujPjC5KJkCGUdvsWJEP – ETH: 0x7A6b92ac5A64A2A5161D89cb980fe4c50E888dCA – […]
